page.title: 02RECLAIMED MOSS LAND
page.content: The designated area is reclaimed moss land. Several feet of peat at variable depths interspersed with Shirdley Hill Sand, on a deep clay bed. Bog oak and ligneous wood surface periodically and have to be dragged or dynamited out. Because of the nature of the land, this wood would be a serious hazzard to farm machinery. This land was reclaimed several generations ago and requires constant drainage. There are no hedges to disect the fields and few trees - usually in small groups or close to the small number of farms in this area. Houses and bungalows are to be found in the village of {Haskayne, and as ribbon development along parts of the moss roads.
